definition: diagram/picture/drawing/chart/map/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to plan/to scheme/to attempt/to pursue/to seek

sentences.english: A warm welcome society all sections of the people joins hands , shows great plans together.
sentences.chinese: 热情欢迎社会各界人士携手合作，共展宏图。

sentences.english: Like many young artists, Mr. Zhang dreamed of making it big in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 和很多年轻艺术家一样，张也曾梦想在北京大展宏图。

sentences.english: Once the drawbridge is down, what happens next is up to you.
sentences.chinese: 吊桥一倒，便是你大展宏图之时。

sentences.english: Wishing you future success and happiness.
sentences.chinese: 祝你宏图大展，幸福快乐。

sentences.english: I hope you have a most happy and prosperous New Year.
sentences.chinese: 我祝愿你在新的一年里最快乐，在事业上大展宏图。

sentences.english: An aggressive young man can go far in our firm.
sentences.chinese: 有进取心的青年人在本公司能大展宏图。

sentences.english: Nation-building needs talent, worked hard and is ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 国家建设需人才，发奋图强宏图现。

sentences.english: Wholeheartedly with colleagues at home and abroad to establish a permanent relationship, grand total Fair.
sentences.chinese: 竭诚与国内外同行建立永久的合作关系，共展宏图。

sentences.english: Let's think big, ie plan ambitiously.
It is a good place where the entrepreneurs want to invest and succeed.
sentences.chinese: 是有志于实业的企业家大展宏图的风水宝地。

sentences.english: Warm welcome from all sectors come and cooperate.
sentences.chinese: 热情欢迎社会各界人士携手合作，共展宏图。

sentences.english: The water of Sanmen River is expecting a great dream.
sentences.chinese: 滚滚三门湾，沉埋几多宏图大愿，梦想期待。

sentences.english: Most people would succeed in small things if they were not troubled with great ambitions.
sentences.chinese: 对大多数人来说，如果没有宏图大志，只能。

sentences.english: I consider my work here as stepping stone for a promising future in this industry.
sentences.chinese: 我把这份工作看作是在业内大展宏图的踏脚石。

sentences.english: The cause of the motherland medicine, human health was ambitious exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 为祖国的医药事业，人类的健康共展宏图。

definition: variant of 宏圖|宏图[hong2 tu2]
lit. to fly upwards swiftly/fig. rapid advance/rapidly developing (situation)
the task of establishing and maintaining hegemony
a flourishing period/period of prosperity/a golden age
